meanings.definition: To make something fuller or rounder in shape.
meanings.sent1: She was plumping the pillows on the couch.
meanings.sent2: The baker was plumping up the dough to make fluffy bread.
meanings.sent3: The balloon animal artist was plumping up the balloon dog to make it extra cute.
meanings.sent4: The gardener was plumping up the soil to create a perfect mound for the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The chef was plumping the mashed potatoes to give them a nice, round shape.

meanings.definition: The act of making something fuller or rounder in shape.
meanings.sent1: The plumping of the cushions made the sofa look more inviting.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the plumping of the dough as it rose in the oven.
meanings.sent3: The plumping of the cheeks with blush gave her a rosy glow.
meanings.sent4: The plumping of the clouds signaled an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The plumping of the pillows added a touch of elegance to the room.
